plump.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: slightly fat in a fairly pleasant way – used especially about women or children, often to avoid saying the word ‘fat’
plump.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The nurse was a cheerful plump woman.
plump.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: round and full in a way that looks attractive
plump.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to gently hit cushions or pillows in order to make them rounder and softer
plump.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put something down suddenly and carelessly
plump.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Plump the bags down anywhere you like.
plump.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: if dried fruit plumps up, or if you plump it up, it becomes fatter and softer when in liquid
plump.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Soak the apricots and raisins until the fruit plumps up.
